page.title: 07The West Glamorgan Chronicle
page.content: In 1961 a man called Gwyn Evans decided to publish a newspaper called the'Chronicle'as well as the'Guardian' which he ran already.It was called the 'Loughor Chronicle at first but is now known as the'West Glamorgan Chronicle' the word'chronicle'means a record of events in the order that they happen. The paper contains local and sports news,there are advertisments to sell cars and houses and competitions. Sometimes there are reports about our school.There is a special page for the farmers of the area and as the'Chronicle'only comes out every Friday,the weekend television guide. A reporter,Mr Huntley came to tell us about his work.He said that the main work of the paper was to tell the local news,including reports of council meetings and court cases.The paper costs 14p and contains 36 pages.
